      and Financial Statement Schedules</font></div>

              <td valign="top" width="7%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="10%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="47%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;31</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="57%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Signatures</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="7%">
                <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      32</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="top" width="57%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Index
      to Financial Statements</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="7%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">F-1</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div><br>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          </div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div><br>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NORTHERN
OIL AND GAS, INC.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2007
ANNUAL REPORT ON FORM 10-K</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PART
I</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Business</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Overview</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Northern
Oil and Gas, Inc. (the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our&#8221; and words of similar import)
is a growth-oriented independent energy company engaged in the acquisition,
exploration, exploitation and development of oil and natural gas
properties.&#160;&#160;Prior to March 20, 2007, our name was &#8220;Kentex Petroleum,
Inc.,&#8221; a Nevada corporation incorporated on October 5, 2006.&#160;&#160;The
Company took its present form on March 20, 2007, when Northern Oil and Gas,
Inc.&#160;&#160;(&#8220;NOG&#8221;), a Nevada corporation engaged in the Company&#8217;s current
business, merged with and into our subsidiary, with NOG remaining as the
surviving corporation (as more fully discussed below).&#160;&#160;NOG then
merged into us, and we were the surviving corporation.&#160;&#160;We then
changed our name to Northern Oil and Gas, Inc.&#160;&#160;References made herein
to &#8220;Kentex&#8221; refer to the Company&#8217;s status and operations prior to March 20,
2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company was originally organized under the laws of the State of Nevada on
February 10, 1983, principally for the purpose of engaging in any lawful
activity.&#160;&#160;In March of 1983, Kentex completed a merger and began
pursuing opportunities in the development and production of oil well facilities
including entering into leases and partnerships and acting as general partner of
ventures.&#160;&#160;These operations proved to be unsuccessful and ended over
ten years ago, where, up until the merger of Kentex with and into NOG (as more
fully discussed below) there had been no further operations or assets in
Kentex.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On or
about January 18, 2006, Kentex received notification that the NASD had approved
the Form 211 application for addition to the OTC Bulletin Board under the ticker
symbol &#8220;KNTX&#8221;, effective January 19, 2006.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 19, 2006, Kentex filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission a
Current Report on Form 8-K disclosing that Kentex executed a Letter of Intent to
acquire NOG, and issued a Press Release in that respect on December 19,
2006.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On March
20, 2007, Kentex acquired Northern Oil and Gas, Inc., a Nevada corporation
(&#8220;NOG&#8221;), pursuant to an Agreement and Plan of Merger (the &#8220;Merger Agreement&#8221;) by
and among us, Kentex Acquisition Corp., a Nevada corporation and our wholly
owned subsidiary (the &#8220;Merger Sub&#8221;), and NOG.&#160;&#160;The Merger Agreement
provided that, effective March 20, 2007, Kentex Acquisition Corp. merged with
and into NOG, with NOG as the surviving corporation (the
&#8220;Merger&#8221;).&#160;&#160;We issued 21,173,013 shares of our common stock in
exchange for 100% of the outstanding shares of NOG.&#160;&#160;Upon closing of
the Merger, the former stockholders of NOG thereafter controlled approximately
94% of our outstanding shares of common stock.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Additional
material terms of the Merger are as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
              </td>
              <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOG
      paid to certain Kentex shareholders and consultants $415,000 under a
      Principal Shareholders Agreement that was a condition of the Merger
      Agreement.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
              </td>
              <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As
      part of the Principal Shareholders Agreement, immediately following the
      closing, these same shareholders of Kentex also agreed to exchange
      approximately 1,680,000 additional shares of Kentex in consideration of
      the issuance of approximately 1,310,075 shares of newly &#8220;restricted
      securities&#8221; that are shares of common stock of Kentex, in consideration of
      compromising certain claims for (i) expenses advanced to Kentex by any of
      them; (ii) any other claims that any of them may have against Kentex;
      (iii) their agreement to enter into a Lock-Up/Leak-Out Agreement covering
      the resale of these shares as negotiated by NOG; and (iv) the granting of
      certain registration rights regarding an aggregate of 250,000 of these
      shares, and demand registration rights to cover all of these shares in the
      event it is subsequently determined that no resale of these person&#8217;s
      shares can be made unless made pursuant to an effective registration
      statement.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 54pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
              </td>
              <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">All
      shares of Kentex held by pre-Merger officers, directors, affiliates and
      consultants are subject to a twenty-four (24) month Lock-Up/Leak-Out
      Agreement.&#160;&#160;This Lock-Up/Leak-Out Agreement provides that, after
      such shares become available for resale pursuant to SEC Rule 144, sales
      may only be made during the leak-out period in accordance with leak-out
      provisions, which include a price floor, broker&#8217;s transactions and a
      manner of sale requirement, and allow no more than 1/12<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
      of the holdings to be sold on a cumulative basis for a period of twelve
      (12) months.&#160;&#160;For example, in the second month of the leak-out
      period, 2/12<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">th</font>
      of the shares governed by the Lock-Up/Leak-Out Agreement would be
      available for resale.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
              </td>
              <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Up
      to 250,000 of the Kentex shares retained by the pre-Merger shareholders
      carry so-called &#8220;piggyback&#8221; registration rights, which give the
      shareholders the right to include such shares in any registration
      statement filed by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission
      (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) within twelve (12) months after the closing of the
      Merger.&#160;&#160;Such shares will also be subject to a Lock-Up/Leak-Out
      Agreement commencing on the date of the effectiveness of such a
      registration statement and expiring twelve (12) months following the date
      of the closing of the Merger.&#160;&#160;For example, if the registration
      statement becomes effective six (6) months following the closing of the
      Merger, one-sixth (1/6) of the shares governed by the Lock-Up/Leak-Out
      Agreement would be available on a cumulative basis for the remaining six
      (6) months of the leak-out period.&#160;&#160;This Lock-Up/Leak-Out
      Agreement will also include manner of sale and broker&#8217;s transactions
      requirements and a price floor.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
      </font></div>
              </td>
              <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
      conjunction with more restrictive lock-up agreements executed by the
      founders of the Company on August 26, 2007, the principal pre-merger
      shareholders agreed to extend the provisions of the lock-up to limit the
      amount of open market sales to the 250,000 shares granted registration
      rights until August 2008.&#160;&#160;Beginning in August 2008, the
      pre-merger shareholders are entitled to sell one-sixth (1/6) of their
      remaining shares per month subject to the same manner of sale and price
      floor requirements as previously agreed
to.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Prior to
the Merger, Kentex was a thinly capitalized publicly-held &#8220;shell
company&#8221;&#8212;meaning that it had no material assets or operations other than to
acquire another business or companies&#8212;and NOG was a recently formed
developmental stage company that had just commenced
operations.&#160;&#160;Privately-held companies desiring to &#8220;go public&#8221; in a
manner other than an initial public offering (commonly referred to as an &#8220;IPO&#8221;)
often seek a reorganization or merger with a shell company to avoid the high
cost of registering securities for public sale, including attendant legal and
accounting expenses, and the usually lengthy process involved in the
registration of securities.&#160;&#160;A transaction like the Merger between the
Merger Sub and NOG, whereby a majority of the shares of Kentex were issued to
NOG shareholders, is described as a &#8220;reverse&#8221; merger because the acquired
company (NOG) usually have substantially greater assets than the acquiring
publicly-held company (Kentex), and the stockholders of the acquired company are
usually issued a controlling interest in the acquiring company by reason of the
perceived difference in the relative values of the companies.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As a
result of the Merger, NOG was deemed to be the acquiring company for financial
reporting purposes and the transaction has been accounted for as a reverse
merger.&#160;&#160;The financial statements presented in the Company&#8217;s December
31, 2006, 10-KSB report were the historical financial statements of Kentex
Petroleum, Inc, the predecessor company.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Immediately
following the Merger, the Company completed a so-called short-form Merger with
NOG, in which NOG merged into the Company, and the Company was the surviving
entity.&#160;&#160;As a part of this short-form Merger, the Company changed its
name to &#8220;Northern Oil and Gas, Inc&#8221;.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On March
17, 2008 the Company received an approval letter to begin trading on the
American Stock Exchange (the &#8220;AMEX&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Our common stock commenced
trading on the AMEX on March 26, 2008 under the symbol &#8220;NOG.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As a
result of the reverse merger with NOG described above, our main business focus
has been directed to oil and gas exploration and development.&#160;&#160;Unless
specifically stated otherwise, our primary operations are now those formerly
operated by NOG as well as other business activities since March, 2007, since
the Company itself did not engage in any substantial business activities prior
to the Merger.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Business</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are a
growth-oriented independent energy company engaged in the acquisition,
exploration, exploitation and development of oil and natural gas properties, and
have focused our activities primarily on projects based in the Rocky Mountain
Region of the United States, specifically the Williston Basin.&#160;&#160;This
is based upon a belief that we are able to create value via strategic acreage
acquisitions and convert that value or portion thereof into production by
utilizing experienced industry partners specializing in the specific areas of
interest.&#160;&#160;We have targeted specific prospects and began drilling for
oil in the Williston Basin region in the fourth fiscal quarter of
2007.&#160;&#160;As of March 31, 2008, we have completed five successful
discoveries, consisting of four targeting the Bakken formation and one targeting
a Red River Structure.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As an
exploration company, our business strategy is to identify and exploit resources
in and adjacent to existing or indicated producing areas that can be quickly
developed and put in production at low cost.&#160;&#160;We also intend to take
advantage of our expertise in aggressive land acquisition to develop exploratory
projects with extremely attractive growth potential in focus areas and to
participate with other companies in those areas to explore for oil and natural
gas using state-of-the-art three-dimensional (3-D) seismic
technology.&#160;&#160;We believe our competitive advantage lies in our ability
to acquire property in the most exciting new plays in a nimble and efficient
fashion.&#160;&#160;We are focused on low overhead.&#160;&#160;We believe we are
in a position to most efficiently exploit and identify high production oil and
gas properties.&#160;&#160;We intend to continue to actively pursue the
acquisition of properties that fit our profile.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Because
we recently acquired most of our acreage positions and did not commence drilling
activities until the fourth fiscal quarter of 2007, we did not perform any
reservoir engineering calculations in the 2007 fiscal year. We anticipate
initiating and performing our initial reservoir engineering calculations
throughout the first and second fiscal quarters of 2008.&#160;&#160;Although we
began oil production in the fourth fiscal quarter of 2007, we did not receive
payment or recognize revenue from sales in the 2007 fiscal year. As such, we
will recognize revenue when we are able to make the appropriate accounting
determinations.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Acreage
Acquisitions and Recent Developments</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the fiscal year ended December 31, 2007, we focused our operations&#160;on
acquiring leaseholds and drilling exploratory and developmental wells primarily
in the Rocky Mountain Region of the United States.&#160;&#160;Our principal
<font style="DISPLAY: inline">assets are located in the Williston Basin
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">region of the northern United States
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">and Yates County</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">,</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> New
York</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, and</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> include the following primary positions</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> as of </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">December 31,
2007</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">:</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">21,354</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> net
      acres</font>&#160;located in Sheridan County,&#160;Montana,&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline">representing a stacked pay </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">prospect</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">;</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>

                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">A</font>pproximately <font style="DISPLAY: inline">13,000</font> net acres located in Mountrail
      County&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline">North Dakota, within and
      surrounding to the north south and west the Parshall Field currently being
      developed by EOG Resources to target the Bakken Shale</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">;</font></font></div>

                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">7,500
      net acres</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">located </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">in
      Burke and Divide Counties of North Dakota</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, in which we are targeting </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">the Winnepegosis Shale</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> on </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">acreage
      in </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">close </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">proximity to a recent Continental
      Resou</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">rces Discovery in the formation;
      and</font></font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately 10,000 net acres </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">located </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">in
      </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">the &#8220;Finger Lakes&#8221; region of
      </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Yates County</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">,</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">New

      </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">production </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">from the Trenton/Black River, Marcellus and
      Queenstown-Medina
formations.</font></font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">We have also completed other miscellaneous acreage
acquisitions in North Dak</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">ota</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">. </font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
