      by relevant governments pertaining to incentives for alternative energy
      development programs;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">fluctuations
      in interest rates and the availability of capital in the capital markets;
      and</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">significant
      sales of our common stock, including sales by selling stockholders
      following the registration of shares under a
  prospectus.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">These and
other factors are largely beyond our control, and the impact of these risks,
singly or in the aggregate, may result in material adverse changes to the market
price of our common stock and/or our results of operations and financial
condition.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
operating results may fluctuate significantly, and these fluctuations may cause
the price of our common stock to decline.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
operating results will likely vary in the future primarily as the result of
fluctuations in our revenues and operating expenses, including the coming to
market of oil and natural gas reserves that we are able to discover and develop,
expenses that we incur, the prices of oil and natural gas in the commodities
markets and other factors.&#160;&#160;If our results of operations do not meet
the expectations of current or potential investors, the price of our common
stock may decline.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Stockholders
will experience dilution upon the exercise of options.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
December 31, 2007, we had authorized the issuance of up to 2,000,000 shares of
common stock underlying options that may be granted, of which options for
1,660,000 shares of common stock had already been granted, and of those granted,
660,000 remain outstanding, pursuant to the Company&#8217;s 2006 Incentive Stock
Option Plan.&#160;&#160;If the holders of those remaining outstanding options
exercise those options, stockholders may experience dilution in the net tangible
book value of our common stock.&#160;&#160;Further, the sale or availability for
sale of the underlying shares in the marketplace could depress our stock
price.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Because
our common stock was deemed a low-priced &#8220;Penny&#8221; stock at times during 2007, an
investment in our common stock may be considered high risk and subject to
marketability restrictions.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
common stock traded at or below $5.00 at times during calendar year 2007, which
qualified our common stock as a &#8220;penny stock,&#8221; as defined in Rule 3a51-1 under
the Securities Exchange Act.&#160;&#160;At such times as the trading price of
our common stock is less than $5.00 per share, trading in the common stock is
subject to the penny stock rules of the Securities Exchange Act specified in
rules 15g-1 through 15g-10.&#160;&#160;Those rules require broker-dealers,
before effecting transactions in any penny stock, to:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Deliver
      to the customer, and obtain a written receipt for, a disclosure
      document;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Disclose
      certain price information about the
stock;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Disclose
      the amount of compensation received by the broker-dealer or any associated
      person of the broker-dealer;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Send
      monthly statements to customers with market and price information about
      the penny stock; and</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
      some circumstances, approve the purchaser&#8217;s account under certain
      standards and deliver written statements to the customer with information
      specified in the rules.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">There can
be no assurance that our common stock will continue to trade above $5.00 per
share.&#160;&#160;Consequently, the penny stock rules may restrict the ability
or willingness of broker-dealers to sell the common stock and may affect the
ability of holders to sell their common stock in the secondary market and the
price at which such holders can sell any such securities.&#160;&#160;These
additional procedures could also limit our ability to raise additional capital
in the future.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">20</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
do not expect to pay dividends in the foreseeable future.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We do not
intend to declare dividends for the foreseeable future, as we anticipate that we
will reinvest any future earnings in the development and growth of our
business.&#160;&#160;Therefore, investors will not receive any funds unless they
sell their common stock, and stockholders may be unable to sell their shares on
favorable terms or at all.&#160;&#160;Investors cannot be assured of a positive
return on investment or that they will not lose the entire amount of their
investment in our common stock.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><a name="FIS_FORWARD_LOOK"><br></a></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
1B. <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Un</font><a name="1b"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">resol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">ved Staff
Comments</font></a></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;None.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
2.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Properties</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Leasehold
Properties</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>Our primary assets are located in the
Williston Basin and as of December 31, 2007, include three principal
positions&#8212;namely:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately 21,354 net acres</font> located in
      Sheridan County,&#160;Montana, <font style="DISPLAY: inline">representing
      a stacked pay prospect;</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">A</font>pproximately <font style="DISPLAY: inline">13,000</font> net acres located in Mountrail
      County&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline">North Dakota, within and
      surrounding to the north and south the Parshall Field currently being
      developed by EOG Resources to target the Bakken Shale;
      and</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Approximately </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">7,500</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> net
      acres located in Burke and </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Divide</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Counties</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> of
      </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">North Dakota</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, in which we are targeting the Winnepegosis Shale
      using acreage in close proximity to a recent Continental
      Resour</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">ces Discovery in the
      formation.</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">These
properties target the same Bakken Shale resource formation.&#160;&#160;We
believe the Bakken formation represents one of the most oil rich, exciting plays
in the Continental United States.&#160;&#160;The North Dakota Geological Survey
currently estimates the reserves in the Bakken formation to be 300 billion
barrels, of which approximately 50% is thought to be currently recoverable,
making it one of the largest resource plays in the Continental United
States.&#160;&#160;W<font style="DISPLAY: inline">e possess three-dimensional
(3-D) seismic data covering our acreage in </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Montana</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> and
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">North Dakota</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, which we hope to utilize to effectively target the
most effective well locations on our acreage to most efficiently develop our
properties. </font>We commenced drilling on the Bakken properties in late
2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
addition, we control approximately <font style="DISPLAY: inline">10,000 net
acres located in the </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#8220;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Fi</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">n</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">ger Lakes</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">&#8221;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline"> region of
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Yates County</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">New
York</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">, in which </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">we </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline">are targeting
natural gas production from the Trenton/Black River, Marcellus and
Queenstown-Medina formations.&#160;&#160;</font>We possess two-dimension (2-D)
seismic data veering this position.&#160;&#160;Two wells were recently permitted
to be drilled by Chesapeake Energy proximal to our acreage.&#160;&#160;We expect
these wells to be drilled in 2008.&#160;&#160;This property is outside of our
core focus area and is subject to divestiture although no assurances can be
given that we could complete a transaction.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Subsequent
to December 31, 2007, we have increased our position in Mountrail County, North
Dakota to</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">approximately
22,000 net acres and have acquired approximately 1,500 net acres in and around
Marathon Oil production in Dunn County, North Dakota.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We have a
continuing working relationship with Montana Oil Properties, Inc., a top land
leasing group out of Billings, Montana, with over 50 years of experience in land
procurement in the region.&#160;&#160;We believe this relationship will continue
to produce opportunities for land acquisition and allow us to acquire the most
promising prospects with great agility.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">For a
detailed description of our leasehold acquisition activities during fiscal year
2007, see &#8220;Business&#8211;Acreage Acquisitions and Recent Developments&#8221; in Item 1 of
this report.</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Reserves</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As we have completed our first wells in
the fourth quarter of 2007, we have not yet performed any reservoir engineering
calculations. We anticipate initiating and performing our initial reservoir
engineering calculations throughout the first and second fiscal quarters of
2008.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Production</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As of December 31, 2007 we had two
wells that had just begun to produce oil.&#160;&#160;We have not yet received
sales or payment data from our operating partners or purchasers regarding this
production.&#160;&#160;As of March 31, 2008 we are selling oil from a total
of&#160;six separate wells.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Well
Data</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>As of March 31, 2008,&#160;we
have&#160;six productive oil wells that either we have drilled through our
Brigham joint venture or on a &#8220;heads-up&#8221; basis directly proportionate to our
working interest.&#160;&#160;Three wells are located in Mountrail County, North
Dakota,&#160;two wells are&#160;located in Dunn County, North Dakota and one
well is located in Sheridan County, Montana.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Undeveloped
and Developed Acreage</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
March 31, 2008, the Company owned rights to an aggregate of approximately 62,000
net mineral acres.&#160;&#160;The majority of our current acreage remains
undeveloped.&#160;&#160;In 2007 we commenced drilling of&#160;2 separate wells
on an aggregate of approximately 960 net mineral acres&#160;in&#160;North Dakota
and Montana. For a detailed description of our drilling activity, see
&#8220;Business&#8211;Drilling Projects&#8221; in Item 1 of this report.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Drilling
Activity</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">For a
description of our Drilling Activity, see &#8220;Business&#8211;Drilling Projects&#8221; in Item 1
of this report.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Present
Activities and Recent Developments</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>For a description of our Present
Activities and Recent Developments, see &#8220;Business &#8211; Acquisitions in 2007 and
Recent Developments&#8221; in Item 1 of this report.&#160;&#160;We consider each of
our significant properties to be suitable for its intended use.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Delivery
Commitments</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font>The Company does not currently have any
delivery commitments for product obtained from its wells.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
3.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Legal
Proceedings</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Currently,
no legal proceedings or claims are pending against or involve us that, in the
opinion of our management, could reasonably be expected to have a material
adverse effect on our business, prospects, financial condition or results of
operations.&#160;&#160;To the knowledge of management, no federal, state or
local governmental agency is presently contemplating any proceeding against the
Company.&#160;&#160;No director, executive officer or affiliate of the Company
or owner of record or beneficially of more than five percent of the Company&#8217;s
common stock is a party adverse to the Company or has a material interest
adverse to the Company in any proceeding.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Item 4.&#160;&#160;<font style="FONT-STYLE: italic">Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security
Holders</font></font><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font></font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">No
matters were submitted to a vote of our stockholders during the fourth fiscal
quarter of 2007.</font></div>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">32</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="47%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Director
      and Chief Financial Officer</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Michael L. Reger </font>has served
as our Chief Executive Officer, Secretary and a Director since the reverse
merger with NOG in March 2007.&#160;&#160;Mr. Reger has been primarily involved
in the acquisition of oil &amp; gas mineral rights for his entire professional
life and is a director of Reger Oil based in Billings, Montana.&#160; Mr. Reger
holds a BA in Finance and an MBA in Finance/Management from the University of
St. Thomas in St. Paul, Minnesota. The Reger family has a history of acreage
acquisition in the Williston&#160;Basin dating to 1952.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Ryan R. Gilbertson </font>has served
as our Chief Financial Officer and a Director since the reverse merger with NOG
in March 2007.&#160;&#160;Mr. Gilbertson is a Principal of Crystal Bay Capital,
a boutique investment banking firm focused on small to mid-size companies.&#160;
Mr. Gilbertson&#8217;s last position prior to founding Crystal Bay Companies was
Director of Equity Derivative Trading and Strategy at Piper Jaffray in
Minneapolis from March 2004 to August 2006. Prior to Piper Jaffray, Ryan was a
portfolio manager at Telluride Asset Management, a multi-strategy hedge fund
based in Wayzata, Minnesota. Ryan holds a BA from
Gustavus&#160;Adolphus&#160;College.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PART
II</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
5.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Market for
Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of
Equity Securities</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Market
Information</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company&#8217;s common stock was listed on the OTC Bulletin Board of the National
Association of Securities Dealers (&#8220;NASD&#8221;) on January 19, 2006, under the symbol
&#8220;KNTX&#8221;, but there was no active trading prior to approximately December
2006.&#160;&#160;Effective April 3, 2007, after the Merger and name change, the
Company&#8217;s symbol was changed to &#8220;NOGS.OB.&#8221;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><a name="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_9">The bid and offer price for the shares of common
stock of our Company for the quarterly periods set forth below are as follows,
although data prior to March 2007 is not applicable to the current structure of
the Company:</a></font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
prices set forth above were obtained from the National Quotation Bureau, Inc.
and do not necessarily reflect actual transactions, retail markups, mark downs
or commissions.&#160;&#160;Stock price data before March 20, 2007, is for the
prior &#8220;shell company&#8221;&#8212;Kentex&#8212;and therefore may not be relevant to any analysis
of the post-Merger Company.&#160;&#160;Kentex common stock did not commence
quotation until the third quarter of fiscal year 2006.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt"></font><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent">The
last reported sales price for our common stock on the AMEX on March 28, 2008 was
$7.05 per share.</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Holders</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As of
March 31, 2008, 28,900,970 shares of our common stock were outstanding, held by
approximately 500 shareholders of record.&#160;&#160;The number of record
holders does not necessarily bear any relationship to the number of beneficial
owners of our common stock.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Dividends</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 54pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
payment of dividends is subject to the discretion of our Board of Directors and
will depend, among other things, upon our earnings, our capital requirements,
our financial condition, and other relevant factors.&#160;&#160;We have not paid
or declared any dividends upon our common stock since our inception and, by
reason of our present financial status and our contemplated financial
requirements, and do not anticipate paying any dividends upon our common stock
in the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;We intend to reinvest any earnings in the
development and expansion of our business.&#160;&#160;Any cash dividends in the
future to common stockholders will be payable when, as and if declared by our
Board of Directors or our Compensation Committee, based upon either the Board&#8217;s
or the Committee&#8217;s assessment of:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">our
      financial condition and
performance;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">

              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">earnings;</font></div>

paid.</font></div>

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Recent
Sales of Unregistered Securities; Use of Proceeds from Registered
Securities</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
September 12, 2007, we issued 115,000 shares of restricted common stock to MOP
as partial consideration for our acquisition of leases covering approximately
4,650 net mineral acres in Mountrail County, North Dakota.&#160;&#160;On October
24, 2007, we issued an additional 132,500 shares of restricted common stock to
MOP as partial consideration for our acquisition of leases covering
approximately 4,197 net mineral acres in Mountrail County, North
Dakota.&#160;&#160;The principals of MOP are Mr. Steven Reger and Mr. Tom Ryan,
both are uncles of our Chief Executive Officer, Michael Reger.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">O<font style="DISPLAY: inline">n September 21, 2007, we issued </font>275,000 shares of
restricted common stock <font style="DISPLAY: inline">to </font>Gallatin
Resources, LLC as partial consideration for our acquisition of leases covering
approximately 10,000 net mineral acres in the Yates County, New York, which is
located in the Appalachia Basin.&#160;&#160;Mr. Carter Stewart, one of the
Company&#8217;s directors, owns a 25% interest in Gallatin Resources,
LLC.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">
          <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
November 2007, we issued an aggregate of 62,000 shares of restricted common
stock to Insight Capital Consultants Corporation and 17,500 shares of common
stock to Wall Street Resources, Inc. as consideration for consulting
services.&#160;&#160;During November 2007, we also issued an aggregate of 44,000
shares of restricted common stock to four separate individuals who provided
consulting services to the Company on various business
matters.&#160;&#160;Further, on November 26, 2007, we issued 75,000 shares of
restricted common stock to Chad Winter upon commencement of his employment with
the Company.</font></div><br><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;All of the
foregoing shares were issued pursuant to the exemption from registration
provided in Section 4(2) of the Act.&#160;&#160;In each instance, the recipients
of the shares were afforded an opportunity for effective access to files and
records of the Company that contained the relevant information needed to make
its investment decision, including the Company&#8217;s financial statements and
reports filed pursuant to the Exchange Act.&#160;&#160;We reasonably believe
that each recipient, immediately prior to issuing the shares, had such knowledge
and experience in financial and business matters that it was capable of
evaluating the merits and risks of its investment.&#160;&#160;Each recipient had
the opportunity to speak with our officers and directors on several occasions
prior to their investment decision.</font></div><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">

      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
6.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Selected
Financial Data</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Not
Applicable.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Management&#8217;s
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operation</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">This
Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
Operations contains forward-looking statements regarding future events and our
future results that are subject to the safe harbors created under the Securities
Act of 1933 (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;) and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the
&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;). &#160;All statements other than statements of historical facts
included in this report regarding our financial position, business strategy,
plans and objectives of management for future operations, industry conditions,
and indebtedness covenant compliance are forward-looking
statements.&#160;&#160;When used in this report, forward-looking statements are
generally accompanied by terms or phrases such as &#8220;estimate,&#8221; &#8220;project,&#8221;
&#8220;predict,&#8221; &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;expect,&#8221; &#8220;anticipate,&#8221; &#8220;target,&#8221; &#8220;plan,&#8221; &#8220;intend,&#8221;
&#8220;seek,&#8221; &#8220;goal,&#8221; &#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; &#8220;may&#8221; or other words and similar expressions
that convey the uncertainty of future events or outcomes.&#160;&#160;Items
contemplating or making assumptions about, actual or potential future sales,
market size, collaborations, and trends or operating results also constitute
such forward-looking statements.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Forward-looking
statements involve inherent risks and uncertainties, and important factors (many
of which are beyond our Company&#8217;s control) that could cause actual results to
differ materially from those set forth in the forward-looking statements,
including the following, general economic or industry conditions, nationally
and/or in the communities in which our Company conducts business, changes in the
interest rate environment, legislation or regulatory requirements, conditions of
the securities markets, our ability to raise capital, changes in accounting
principles, policies or guidelines, financial or political instability, acts of
war or terrorism, other economic, competitive, governmental, regulatory and
technical factors affecting our Company&#8217;s operations, products, services and
prices.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We have
based these forward-looking statements on our current expectations and
assumptions about future events.&#160;&#160;While our management considers these
expectations and assumptions to be reasonable, they are inherently subject to
significant business, economic, competitive, regulatory and other risks,
contingencies and uncertainties, most of which are difficult to predict and many
of which are beyond our control.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, results actually
achieved may differ materially from expected results in these
statements.&#160;&#160;Forward-looking statements speak only as of the date they
are made.&#160;&#160;You should consider carefully the statements in this &#8220;Item
1A. Risk Factors&#8221; and other sections of this report, which describe factors that
could cause our actual results to differ from those set forth in the
forward-looking statements.&#160;&#160;Our Company does not undertake, and
specifically disclaims, any obligation to update any forward-looking statements
to reflect events or circumstances occurring after the date of such
statements.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Except
as discussed below, a discussion of our past financial results is not pertinent
to the business plan of the Company on a going forward basis, due to the change
in our business which occurred upon consummation of the merger on March 20,
2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Overview
and Outlook</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are an
oil and gas exploration and production company.&#160;&#160;Our properties are
located in Montana, North Dakota and New York.&#160;&#160;Our corporate strategy
is to build shareholder value through the development and acquisition of oil and
gas assets that exhibit economically producible hydrocarbons.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
currently control the rights to mineral leases on approximately 115,000 gross
acres of land, 62,000 net acres of land.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">26</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our goal
is to explore for and develop hydrocarbons within the mineral leases we control
as well as continue to expand our acreage position.&#160;&#160;In order to
accomplish our objectives we may need to achieve the following;</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Raise
      the necessary capital required to acquire, explore for and produce oil,
      conventional natural gas and unconventional natural
  gas;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Assemble
      a group of talented and experienced employees, partners and consultants to
      execute the strategic objectives;</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Create
      value by executing an &#8216;asset roll up&#8217; business plan, subsequently
      optimizing the value of each newly acquired property.&#160;&#160;Executing
      this phase of the strategy should in turn provide asset value for the
      acquisition and enhancement of additional properties, and create synergies
      among these assets, further improving their value;
  and</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div>
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
            <tr valign="top">
              <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#9642;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Identify
      and utilize industry partners to mitigate risk and leverage resources and
      acreage through joint ventures, farm-out agreements and strategic pooling
      of acreage.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Results
of Operations for the period ended December 31, 2006 and December 31,
2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We are in
the early stage of developing our properties in Montana, North Dakota and New
York and currently have limited quantities of production from these
properties.&#160;&#160;Our operations to date have been limited to technical
evaluation of the properties and the design of development plans to exploit the
oil and gas industry resources on those properties as well as seeking
opportunities to acquire additional oil and gas properties.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Although
we had oil production in the fourth fiscal quarter of 2007 we did not receive
payment from this production in the fiscal year.&#160;&#160;As such, we will
begin to recognize revenue when we are able to make the appropriate accounting
determinations.&#160;As of March 31, 2008,&#160;we have established production
from&#160;six total wells in which we hold small working interest, two of which
had established production as of December 31, 2007. This production approximates
100 barrels of oil per day and we expect will increase to approximately 180
barrels of oil per day when two of the wells reach &#8220;payout.&#8221;&#160;&#160;As of
March 31, 2008 we intend to participate in the drilling of approximately 40
gross oil wells in 2008.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
expenses to date have consisted principally of general and administrative
costs.&#160;&#160;We expect these costs to increase moderately as we proceed
with our development plans.&#160;&#160;In the future we expect to incur
increased geologic, geophysical, and engineering costs.&#160;&#160;Total
expenses for the period from inception (October 5, 2006) through
December&#160;31, 2006, were $76,374 and for the twelve-month period ended
December 31, 2007, were $4,513,189. We had a net loss of $76,107 for the period
from inception (October 5, 2006) through December 31, 2006, and a net loss of
$4,305,293 for the twelve-month period ended December 31, 2007.&#160;&#160;Of
this amount approximately $500,000 was a cash expense, the balance was related
to share issuance costs which is expected to decrease substantially in
2008.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Operation
Plan</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the next twelve months we plan to commence in earnest the development of our oil
and gas properties in conjunction with our drilling partners.&#160;&#160;We have
several other projects that are in various stages of discussions and are
continually evaluating oil and gas opportunities in the Continental United
States</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">To
accelerate the development program we may take on further joint venture or
&#8220;working interest&#8221; partners that will contribute to the capital costs of
drilling and completion and then share in revenues derived from
production.&#160;&#160;This economic strategy may allow us to utilize our own
financial assets toward the growth of our leased acreage holdings, pursue the
acquisition of strategic oil and gas producing properties or companies and
generally expand our existing operations.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Because
of our limited operating history we have recognized no revenues from the sale of
oil and/or gas.&#160;&#160;Our activities have been primarily limited to the
negotiation of working interest agreements, mineral lease acquisition and
preliminary analysis of reserves and production
capabilities.&#160;&#160;Consequently, we have incurred the expenses of
start-up.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">27</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
future financial results will depend primarily on: (i) the ability to continue
to source and screen potential projects; (ii) the ability to discover commercial
quantities of oil and gas; (iii) the market price for oil and gas; and (iv) the
ability to fully implement our exploration and development program, which is
dependent on the availability of capital resources.&#160;&#160;There can be no
assurance that we will be successful in any of these respects, that the prices
of oil and gas prevailing at the time of production will be at a level allowing
for profitable production, or that we will be able to obtain additional funding
to increase our currently limited capital resources.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2008
Drilling Projects</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2008,
we intend to continue drilling efforts on our existing acreage covering an
aggregate of 62,000 net mineral acres in Mountrail County, North Dakota and
Sheridan County, Montana, and to commence drilling or participate in at least 40
new wells. For a detailed description of our drilling activity, see
&#8220;Business&#8211;Drilling Projects&#8221; in Item 1 of this report.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Liquidity
and Capital Resources</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Liquidity
is a measure of a company&#8217;s ability to meet potential cash
requirements.&#160;&#160;We have historically met our capital requirements
through the issuance of common stock and by short term borrowings.&#160;&#160;In
the future, we anticipate we will be able to provide the necessary liquidity by
the revenues generated from the sales of our oil and gas reserves in our
existing properties, however, if we do not generate sufficient sales revenues we
will continue to finance our operations through equity and/or debt
financings.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following table summarizes total current assets, total current liabilities and
working capital at December 31, 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 446pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 72pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">
        <div>&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align="center">
          <table bgcolor="white" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="46%" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">
              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff" style="TEXT-ALIGN: left;">
                <td width="31%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;Current
      Assets</font></td>
                <td width="39%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;$
      10,502,630</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="white">
                <td width="31%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;Current
      Liabilities</font></td>
                <td width="39%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;$&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
      224,247</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr bgcolor="#cceeff">
                <td width="31%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;Working
      Capital&#160;</font></td>
                <td width="39%"><font style="FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;$
      10,278,383</font></td>
              </tr>
          </table>
        </div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 446pt">&#160;</div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 72pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Satisfaction
of our cash obligations for the next 12 months.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
currently are funded to meet our minimum drilling commitments and expected
general and administrative expenses for the first half of 2008.&#160;&#160;The
accelerated pace of development in the Bakken play may require us to access the
capital markets at some point in 2008.&#160;&#160;We intend to utilize one or
more debt facilities to cover our projected shortfall, however there can be no
assurance such capital will be available to us on favorable terms or at
all.&#160;&#160;We anticipate the continuing acquisition of acreage may require
additional funds which we anticipate obtaining through the expected oil and gas
sales commencing in 2008, from our substantial position in the rapidly
developing Parshall Field as well as our other prospects.&#160;&#160;<a name="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_11">A critical component of our operating plan
impacting our continued existence is the ability to obtain additional capital
through additional equity and/or debt financing. In the event we cannot obtain
the necessary capital to pursue our strategic plan, we may have to cease or
significantly curtail our acreage acquisitions.&#160;&#160;This would materially
impact our ability to continue operations.&#160;&#160;However, due to our low
overhead, we are not dependant on new capital if we do not wish to accelerate
our drilling programs and/or buy up working interests in potential wells during
the next 24 months.</a></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Since
inception, we have financed cash flow requirements through debt financing and
issuance of common stock for cash and services.&#160;&#160;As we expand
operational activities, we may continue to experience net negative cash flows
from operations, pending receipt of sales or development revenues from the sale
of oil and gas, and will be required to obtain additional financing to fund
operations through common stock offerings and debt borrowings to the extent
necessary to provide working capital.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Over the
next 24 months we believe that existing capital and anticipated funds from
operations may not be sufficient to sustain planned expansion, primarily acreage
acquisition.&#160;&#160;Consequently, we may seek additional capital in the
future to fund growth and expansion through additional equity or debt financing
or credit facilities.&#160;&#160;No assurance can be made that such financing
would be available, and if available it may take either the form of debt or
equity.&#160;&#160;In either case, the financing could have a negative impact on
our financial condition and our stockholders.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">28</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We may
incur operating losses over the next twelve months.&#160;&#160;Our lack of
operating history makes predictions of future operating results
difficult.&#160;&#160;Our prospects must be considered in light of the risks,
expenses and difficulties frequently encountered by companies in their early
stage of operations, particularly companies in the oil and gas exploration
industry.&#160;&#160;Such risks include, but are not limited to, an evolving and
unpredictable business model and the management of growth.&#160;&#160;To address
these risks we must, among other things, implement and successfully execute our
business and marketing strategy, continue to develop and upgrade technology and
products, respond to competitive developments, and attract, retain and motivate
qualified personnel.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be
successful in addressing such risks, and the failure to do so can have a
material adverse effect on our business prospects, financial condition and
results of operations.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Going
Concern</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
financial statements included in our filings have been prepared in conformity
with generally accepted accounting principles that contemplate the continuance
of the Company as a going concern.&#160;&#160;Management may use borrowings and
security sales to improve the Company&#8217;s cash position; however, no assurance can
be given that debt or equity financing, if and when required, will be
available.&#160;&#160;The financial statements do not include any adjustments
relating to the recoverability and classification of recorded assets and
classification of liabilities that might be necessary should the Company be
unable to continue existence.&#160;&#160;The audited financial statements for
Kentex for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2006, contained a statement by the
auditors indicating their uncertainty that Kentex would be able to continue as a
&#8220;going concern.&#8221;&#160;&#160;The &#8220;going concern&#8221; disclosure is not presented in
the report of our auditors filed herewith, and we believe that the &#8220;going
concern&#8221; disclosure will not be required in our next published financials due to
capital raised by the Company in September 2007.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Summary
of product research and development that we will perform for the term of our
plan.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We do not
anticipate performing any significant product research and development under our
plan of operation until such time as we can raise adequate working capital to
sustain our operations.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Expected
purchase or sale of any significant equipment.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We do not
anticipate the purchase or sale of any plant or significant equipment as such
items are not required by us at this time or anticipated to be needed in the
next twelve months.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Off-Balance
Sheet Arrangements</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We
currently do not have any off-balance sheet arrangements that have or are
reasonably likely to have a current or future effect on our financial condition,
changes in financial condition, revenues or expenses, results of operations,
liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources that is material to
investors.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
7A.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Quantitative
and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Not
Applicable.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
8.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Financial
Statements and Supplementary Data</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
Consolidated Financial Statements required by this item are included on the
pages immediately following the Index to Financial Statements appearing on page
F-1.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Item
9.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Changes In and
Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial
Disclosure</font></font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">None.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">

        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">29</font></div>
